You've already learned this topic. Would you like to
Partition placement groups can scale to 100s of
Partition placement groups consist of multiple EC2
instances placed across different partitions within
an Availability Zone. This means that instances will
be placed on different sets of racks.
The pros of a partition placement group:
- Can span across multiple AZs in the same region
- Up to 100s of EC2 instances available
More pros of partition placement group:
- Instances in a partition do not share racks with
More pros of a partition placement group:
A use case of a partition placement group:
such as: HDFS, HBase, and Cassandra.

You've already learned this topic. Would you like to
Spread placement groups spread instances across
underlying hardware. You can have a maximum of
7 instances per group per availability zone.
The pros of a spread placement group:
- EC2 instances are on different hardware
A use case of a spread placement group:
- Applications that need max high availability, or
critical apps where instances need physical isolation

Which EBS volume would you like to learn more about?
You've already learned this topic. Would you like to
General purpose SSD EBS volumes are cost effective and
have low-latency. They are 1 GiB to 16 TiB in size.
They're used for system boot volumes, virtual desktops,
Have a baseline of 3,000 IOPS and throughput of 125
MiB/s. They can increase IOPS up to 16,000 and
gp2 volumes: Have small gp2 volumes and can bust IOPS
to 3,000 and size of the volume and IOPS are linked.
EBS volumes provide durable and performative block
storage. They can be attached and detached from EC2
instances. EBS volumes are not encrypted by default,
but it is possible to take a 'snapshot' of the EBS
volume and then encrypt the snapshot. Then, restart
the volume as the encrypted version. A snapshot is
a copy of the volume's storage contents and configs
'EBS - High Performance SSD' was added to your items

Classic Load Balancers support TCP (Layer 4), HTTP
and HTTPS (Layer 7) connections of the OSI model. They
have a fixed hostname and health checks are either
Classic Load Balancers are still available and cheaper,
yet they are slowly becoming legacy. It is advised to
opt for an Application load balancer as an alternative.

connections of the OSI model. They

ALB Target Groups can be: ECS tasks, EC2 instances in

With ALB, it is possible to:

- Route based on hostname in URL

You've already learned this topic. Would you like to
Network Load Balancers operate at layer 4 of the OSI
model. They forward TCP & UDP traffic to instances.
They handle millions of requests per seconds and have
less latency (100 ms vs 400 ms per second).
NLB support assigning Elastic IP and only has one
static IP address per AZ. Assigning Elastic IP is
useful when whitelisting an IP address.
Network Load Balancers are the most expensive type
of load balancer offered by AWS.
'Network Load Balancer' was added to your items
You have earned 2 golden AWS points! \$
What about auto scaling groups would you like to
You've already learned this topic. Would you like to
An auto scaling group (ASG) allows for the automatic
creating and removal of servers. 'Scale out' refers
to the addition of EC2 instances to handle increased
app load. 'Scale in' is removal of EC2 instances.
An autoscaling group will recreate an EC2 instance
in case a previous one is terminated (unhealthy
instances). They auto-register new instances to a
load balancer and ensure there is a min and max
number of EC2 instances running at all times. ASGs
are free to create, but you still need to pay for the
'Auto Scaling Group (description)' has been added to
You have earned 2 golden AWS points! \$

ASGs can be integrated with CloudWatch alarms. For
example, an alarm checks a metric (i.e. - average CPU
or custom metric) and scales accordingly.

An SQS standard queue is fully managed and used to
decouple applications. Here are a few SQS features:
An SQS standard queue is fully managed and used to
decouple applications. Here are a few SQS features:
- Unlimited throughput, unlimited number of messages
- Default retention of message is 4 days and has a
- Low latency (<10 ms on publish and receive)
- Able to have duplicate messages and out of order

An SQS FIFO queue represents the order of first in,
first out. It has limited throughput of 300 messages
without batching and 3000 messages with batching.
FIFO queues are more expensive than Standard queues.

You've already learned this topic. Would you like to
A Kinesis data stream is a set of shards.
Each shard has a sequence of data records.
Each data record has a sequence number that is
The producers continually push data to
Kinesis Data Streams, and the consumers process the
data in real time. Consumers (such as a custom
application running on Amazon EC2 or an Amazon Kinesis
Data Firehose delivery stream) can store their results
using an AWS service such as Amazon DynamoDB,
'Kinesis Data Streams' was added to your items

and migrations concepts do you want to go over?

In this DR approach, you simply replicate part of your
IT structure for a limited set of core services so that
the AWS cloud environment seamlessly takes over in the
event of a disaster. A small part of infrastructure is
always running simultaneously syncing mutable data
while other parts of infrastructure are switched
off and used only during testing.
'Pilot Light' was added to your items
You have earned 2 golden AWS points! \$
You've already learned this topic. Would you like to
The term warm standby is used to describe a DR scenario
in which a scaled-down version of a fully functional
environment is always running in the cloud.
A warm standby solution extends the pilot light
elements and preparation. It further decreases the
recovery time because some services are always running.
'Warm Standby' was added to your items
You have earned 2 golden AWS points! \$
You've already learned this topic. Would you like to
This simple and low cost DR approach backs up your data
and applications from anywhere to the AWS cloud for
use during recovery from disaster. Unlike conventional
backup methods, data is not backed up to tape.
'Backup & Restore' was added to your items

Welcome to Ryan's AWS RPG! Would you like to hear the

Welcome to the 2022 AWS Summit at the Javits Center
in New York, New York! Each floor has a different
purpose. The current floor you're on has many people
that will teach you about AWS services and concepts
in order to prepare you for the Solutions Architect
Associate exam. Every time you learn a topic,
you will receive 'golden AWS points' and then
a skill item will be added to your inventory.
You will see your golden AWS points by pressing the
esc key and they will be on the bottom left of the
menu key and selecting on the 'items' section.
You can check your skill items by pressing 'esc'.
You can save your game's process by pressing 'esc'
Up arrow - move up, down arrow - move down, left arrow
- move left, right arrow - move right, spacebar - talk
to people or select something. Esc key - view menu
You can also move your character by clicking the
You can turn off/lower volume for music and sounds
by pressing 'esc', going to 'options', and then
The second floor will have different practice tests
that you can take. Just go up and speak to people and
The third floor will allow you to purchase similar AWS
architectures of popular applications and websites

What about RDS would you like to learn
You've already learned this topic. Would you like to
Amazon RDS Read Replication is a feature
on Amazon RDS that allows you to create one
or more read copies of the primary database
within the same or different AWS region.
The data from the master database is
The benefits of RDS read replicas are:
In an Amazon RDS Multi-AZ deployment,
Amazon RDS automatically creates a primary
over to a standby instance without manual
Here are the benefits of RDS Multi-AZ:
Automatically fail in over typically under 35 seconds
Use separate endpoints for reads and writes
Gain up to 2x faster transaction commit latency

What about Aurora would you like to learn?
You've already learned this topic. Would you like to
Amazon Aurora (Aurora) is a fully managed relational
database engine that's compatible with MySQL and
PostgreSQL. The code, tools, and applications you use
today with your existing MySQL and PostgreSQL
databases can be used with Aurora. With some
workloads, Aurora can deliver up to five times the
throughput of MySQL and up to three times of PostgreSQL
without requiring changes to the application.
Aurora is a more expensive option compared to RDS.
'Aurora overview' has been added to your
You have earned 2 golden AWS points! \$
You've already learned this topic. Would you like to
Aurora Serverless is an on-demand, auto-scaling
feature designed to be a cost-effective approach to
running intermittent or unpredictable workloads on
Aurora. It automatically starts up, shuts down as
'Aurora Serverless' has been added to your
You have earned 2 golden AWS points! \$
You've already learned this topic. Would you like to
Aurora typically involves a cluster of DB instances
instead of a single instance. Each connection
is handled by a specific DB instance.
when you connect to an Aurora cluster, the host name
and port that you specify point to an intermediate
Using endpoints, you can map each connection to the
appropriate instance or group of instances based
on your use case. For example, to perform DDL
statements you can connect to whichever instance is
the primary instance. To perform queries, you connect
to the reader endpoint, with Aurora automatically
performing load-balancing among all the Aurora
The four types of Aurora endpoints are:
A cluster endpoint (or writer endpoint) for an Aurora
DB cluster connects to the current primary DB
instance for that DB cluster. This endpoint is the only
one that can perform write operations such as
DDL statements. Because of this, the cluster endpoint
is the one that you connect to when you first
set up a cluster or when your cluster only contains a
A reader endpoint for an Aurora DB cluster provides
load-balancing support for read-only connections to the
DB cluster. Use the reader endpoint for read operations
like queries. By processing those statements on the
Aurora Replicas, this endpoint reduces the overhead
A custom endpoint for an Aurora cluster represents a
set of DB instances that you choose. When you connect
to the endpoint, Aurora performs load balancing and
chooses one of the instances in the group to handle the
connection. You define which instances this endpoint
refers to, and you decide what purpose the endpoint
serves. An Aurora DB cluster has no custom endpoints
until you create one. You can create up to five custom
An instance endpoint connects to a specific DB instance
within an Aurora cluster. Each DB instance in
a DB cluster has its own unique instance endpoint.
So there is one instance endpoint for the current
primary DB instance of the DB cluster, and there is one
instance endpoint for each of the Aurora Replicas in
the DB cluster. The instance endpoint provides direct
control over connections to the DB cluster, for
scenarios where using the cluster endpoint or reader
'Aurora Endpoints' has been added to your
You have earned 2 golden AWS points! \$

Cache invalidation is the process when
web cache proxies declare cached content as invalid,
and the it will no longer be served as the most current
piece of content when it is requested.
The purpose of cache invalidation is the ensure that
the most current content in the cache is the most
'Cache invalidation' has been added to your
You have earned 2 golden AWS points! \$
You've already learned this topic. Would you like to
Redis and Memcached are both open-house, in-memory
data stores used for caching data.
Redis uses only single nuclei and is more performance
optimized when compared to Memcached. Redis is the
better option when storing data that is 100k in size
Memcached, by comparison, uses multiple nuclei.
Memcached has less options than Redis, like: snapshots,
replication, transactions, pub/sub etc. Due to this,
Memcached is a cheaper option than Redis.
'Redis vs Memcached' has been added to your
You have earned 2 golden AWS points! \$
You've already learned this topic. Would you like to
We will take a look at 3 different caching strategies:
Lazy loading is a caching strategy that loads data
into the cache only when necessary.
A cache hit occurs when data is in the cache and
A cache miss occurs when data isn't in the cache or is
expired. In the event of a cache miss, the application
requests the info from the database and then updates
Write-through adds data or updates data in the cache
whenever data is written to the database. This strategy
is subject to latency, however, clients are more
forgiving of latency when it comes to writes.
TTL (Time to Live) is an integer value that specifies
the number of seconds until the key expires.
When an application attempts to read an expired key,
it is treated as though the key is not found.
'Caching strategies' has been added to your
You have earned 2 golden AWS points! \$

EC2/ASG/CloudWatch Tip #3: If an ASG needs to scale
in regards to scaling metrics and threshold values,
it is advised to use a 'step scaling' policy. Target
scaling is used based on a target value for a metric.

EC2/CloudWatch Tip #4: CloudWatch has a few metrics
that are available out of the box. These metrics are:
Disk Reads, CPU Utilization, and Network packet egress.
Otherwise, you must set up a custom Cloudwatch metric.

EC2/VPC Tip #5: A bastion host must be placed in a
public subnet in order to access resources in private
subnets. A bastion host in this case is an EC2 instance
that is essentially a buffer to help mitigate attacks.

migrate on-prem databases to the AWS cloud. A full load
and change data capture replication task will create a

Networking tip #1: When using Lambda with RDS, it is
possible you might encounter a 'too many connections'
error. To mitigate this, you can set up an RDS proxy,
which handles connections and scaling to your instance.
Would you like another tip on designing networking in a
Networking tip #2: In order to route traffic to a
S3 bucket static website, it is necessary to:
1. Have S3 bucket name and domain name as the same.
2. Use Route 53 as the DNS for the S3 bucket website.
Would you like another tip on designing networking in a
Networking Tip #3: In regards to VPC subnets, every
subnet that is created is automatically associated
with the main route table of the VPC. Also, each subnet
is coordinated to a single AZ.

is encrypted, then all snapshots are automatically
encrypted from said snapshot. Also, data in transit
from the volume and instance is encrypted.

Gateway is used for integration of data from on-prem
to AWS. DataSync is used for migration of data from
on-prem to AWS (typically will decommission on-prem).

Compliance #1: When asked about compliance related
documentation in the cloud, the service that is being
referenced is AWS Artifact. Available reports are:
Service Organization Control and Payment Card Industry.
Security #1: STS (Security Token Service) permits the
creation of more short-term access credentials to
AWS resources for users. STS works similar to IAM, but
is a more temporary solution when compared to IAM.
Security/Compliance #3: AWS Config is used to evaluate
and audit the configurations of your resources. An AWS
Config rule can specify and enforce your desired
configuration of your account's cloud resources.

Flashcard #1: SSD Volumes are used for small I/O
operations. They are used for transactional workloads
are more costly than HDD drives. Usable as boot volume.
Flashcard #2: HDD volumes are used for larger I/O
operations. Used for streaming workloads(big data, data
warehouses etc.) and for data that is infrequently
accessed. Unable to be used as a boot volume.
Flashcard #3: EBS Multi-Attach can be enabled on an EBS
Provisioned IOPS io2 or io1 volume to allow a volume to
be concurrently attached to up to sixteen Nitro-based
EC2 instances within the same AZ.
Flashcard #4: Cold HDD volumes are the cheapest HDD
volumes and are best for colder storage offering up to

Flashcard #1: CloudTrail Log File Validation is a
feature that determines whether a log file was deleted
or modified after it was delivered.
Flashcard #2: CloudTrail Insights Events is a feature
that detects suspicious and unusual API calls in an
management operations that are performed on resources
in your AWS account. Examples: Creating and managing
IAM resources, creating an S3 bucket.
Flashcard #4: CloudTrail Data Events show resource
operations performed on or within a resource in your
AWS account. Example: Invoking Lambda function,
DynamoDB API table actions (PutItem, DeleteItem etc.).
Those are all the CloudWatch/CloudTrail related
flashcards for now. Which topic would you like to
Flashcard #1: EC2 Hibernation writes the in-memory
state into an EBS volume and then shuts down. AMI and
EBS Volume launch the instance is encrypted. When
using hibernation, you only pay for EBS and Elastic IP.

an EC2 instance to accelerate HPC and Machine Learning

instance in a public subnet that allows for connection
to an EC2 instance in a private subnet.
